answers.answer: I read your similar post on the IBS forum. When was the last time you saw a Urologist? As far as your breathing device, its known to help lower BP but does nothing for glucose levels.

There is a condition called Interstitial Cystitis (IC) that goes hand in hand with IBS-C.  The symptoms are exactly as you describe. I thought i suffered from frequent urinary tract infections for the past twenty years and was recently diagnosed with IC.  I would bet money that the urethral burning being IC. Good luck. Having IBS and IC is not fun!

question: I am a  70yr. women who has had numerous bladder infections over the years. Recently, with Diabetes, I have been urinating several times a night.  I have no current infection, and feel my Diabetes is in good control,. Also have IBS-C.and am always fighting constipation. I am experiencing after abt 3 am. urination, a burning in my urethrea, and from my navel to breastbone, aching in the hips, thighs and sometimes at the sides of my abdomen and in back at waist. Last night i also had stinging in my feet and hands . If i get up and sleep in a chair at night or when i am up during the day, i have very few problems.Due to this I get only 3-4 hrs sleep at night. Occasionally, I will have a night without this.Could this be due to the IBS ? or Neuropathy?
title: frequent urination, aching, burning after retireing.
